intro: Silene oxyodonta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, which helps reduce water loss. Silene oxyodonta is an annual plant, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
